result.execSummary:
The defendant Sholonda T Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sholonda T Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sholonda T Jones was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Discharge - regular

The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest and In her petition, Sec. 6A, Defn says "see attached copies...", but nothing is attached, Similarly, in Sec. 6D, she refers to "attached explanation", but nothing is attached.  Essentially, no evidence of successful efforts at rehabilitation.
The district Atty Objects to the Petition for Sentence Adjustment.

filed by Defn Pro Se; Count 2

Defn's request for sentence adjustment is DENIED - Defn has not identified any legal grounds supporting a "sentence modification".  If this is a motion for "sentence adjustment" under Sec. 973.195, the Defn has failed to provide records from the registrar and other documentation that is required.

Referral to Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM)

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
re:  BMP's request for bail condition clarification; Ct signed new order for BMP referral

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.    If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant shall have no contact, direct or indirect, with Victoria L.
Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
